revised_title: High-Temperature Battery Systems: Advancements in Sodium-Sulfur and Sodium-Nickel Chloride Cells
tldr: This article discusses the development and advancements of high-temperature battery systems, specifically sodium-sulfur and sodium-nickel chloride cells. These batteries have high specific energies and are not affected by ambient temperatures, making them suitable for applications like electric vehicles and load leveling. The article highlights the challenges and potential solutions for improving their performance and commercial viability.
